author: Matthew Dalton
title: Gucci Seeks to Escape Fashion’s Boom-Bust
text:
MILAN, Italy—Gucci is in the midst of a boom shadowed by the threat of a bust: fickle shoppers falling out of love with the Italian fashion house as quickly as they embraced it.

Gucci has been on a tear since it hired creative director Alessandro Michele three years ago. Sales have risen nearly 80%, hitting €6.2 billion ($8.1 billion) in 2017. Operating profit has more than doubled to €2.1 billion. Mr. Michele’s kaleidoscopic designs—which mix colorful streetwear, historical references and garish animal prints—have been praised...
